searchDocs.title: Update​
searchDocs.content: </> ShakerInstances:Update( dx: number-- Delta time in seconds (typically from RenderStepped) ) → Vector3 -- The current position offset to accumulate onto the camera Steps the physics simulation forward by dx seconds. Internally this: Advances the cubic fade envelope (CurrentTime^3) Samples Perlin noise for rumble and jitter Applies the damped harmonic oscillator formula Clamps position to prevent explosive values NOTE Calling Update on an inactive shaker will return Vector3.zero and do no work. CAUTION Setting Magnitude above 10^5 risks Resonance — a real physics phenomenon where the forcing frequency matches the system's natural frequency, producing explosive and unregisterable values. SpringShaker will abort and warn if this is detected.

searchDocs.title: FadeOut​
searchDocs.content: </> ShakerInstances:FadeOut( Time: number-- Duration in seconds. Pass 0 for an immediate stop. ) → () Begins fading the shake out over the given duration. Sets SustainComplex to false, enabling the exponential decay envelope on the next Update. Resets RawTime to 0 so decay always starts from e^0 = 1.

searchDocs.title: FadeIn​
searchDocs.content: </> ShakerInstances:FadeIn( Time: number-- Duration in seconds. Pass 0 to start at full magnitude immediately. ) → () Begins fading the shake in over the given duration. Sets SustainComplex to true, holding decay at 1 until FadeOut is called.

searchDocs.title: GetFadeMagnitude​
searchDocs.content: </> ShakerInstances:GetFadeMagnitude() → number Returns the current fade multiplier in the range [0, 1]. Computed as CurrentTime^3 for a cubic ease curve — slow to start, fast to finish.

searchDocs.title: IsShaking​
searchDocs.content: </> ShakerInstances:IsShaking() → boolean Returns true if the shaker is currently active or sustaining at any energy level.

searchDocs.title: IsFadingOut​
searchDocs.content: </> ShakerInstances:IsFadingOut() → boolean Returns true if the shaker is currently in the process of fading out.

searchDocs.title: IsFading​
searchDocs.content: </> ShakerInstances:IsFading() → boolean Returns true if the shaker is currently fading in (has not yet reached full energy).

searchDocs.title: IsDead​
searchDocs.content: </> ShakerInstances:IsDead() → boolean Returns true if the shaker has fully decayed and is safe to recycle. Checks that SustainComplex is false, CurrentTime is at zero, and both Position and Velocity magnitudes are below the settlement threshold.

searchDocs.content: </> ShakerInstances:GetState() → number Returns the current state of this shaker instance as an integer enum value. State Value Reserved -1 Inactive 0 Active 1 FadeInProgress 2 FadeOutProgress 3

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> SpringShaker.new( __SpringShakeDefClass: Batch.__camShakePreset-- The configuration table for the shaker. ) → __SpringShakerClassDef-- Returns the shaker class object. Creates a brand new Springy camera shaker instance. Usage: local MySpringShaker = SpringShaker.new({ Magnitude = 0.5, Roughness = 0.3, FadeInTime = 0.2, FadeOutTime = 0.6, Tension = 120, Damping = 8, Velocity = Vector3.new(0, 0, 0), RotationInfluence = Vector3.new(1, 1, 1), }) SpringShaker:ShakeOnce(MySpringShaker, 2) -- Shakes for apparent 2 seconds.

searchDocs.title: Halt​
searchDocs.content: </> SpringShaker:Halt( SpringDef: __SpringShakerClassDef-- The instance to halt. ) → () Forces a specific shaker instance to stop rendering immediately. This does not use FadeOut method unlike :HaltDurationWise, so it will just stop the shaker without any fade effect. Used in benchmarking or emergency stops.

searchDocs.content: </> SpringShaker:HaltAll( FadeOutTime: number?-- Optional time to override the preset's FadeOutTime. ) → () Iterates through all active shakers and triggers their FadeOut.

searchDocs.content: </> SpringShaker:RecycleAll() → () Immediately stops all rendering and cleans up all memory.

searchDocs.title: HaltDurationWise​
searchDocs.content: </> SpringShaker:HaltDurationWise( Time: number?-- Optional override for the FadeOut duration. ) → () Fades out all active shakers based on their current state. Usage: local SpringShaker = require(path.to.SpringShaker) local ExplosionShake = SpringShaker:GetPreset("Explosion") SpringShaker:ShakeSustained(ExplosionShake) task.delay(3, function() SpringShaker:HaltDurationWise(ExplosionShake.FadeOutTime) -- Smoothly fades out after 3 seconds. end)

searchDocs.title: ShakeIndividual​
searchDocs.content: </> SpringShaker:ShakeIndividual( SpringDef: __SpringShakerClassDef,-- The preset configuration. Duration: number?-- How long before fadeout triggers. ) → () Plays a shake once, but creates a fully independent instance per call. Safe for rapid fire — each call lives and dies on its own without stomping previous shakes. Useful for gun recoil, footsteps, or any shake that may be triggered multiple times in quick succession. Usage: local SpringShaker = require(path.to.SpringShaker) SpringShaker:ShakeIndividual(SpringShaker:GetPreset("M2Recoil"), 0.3)
